title: Chapter One: A Planet in Peril
description: Crashing on Mongo, Flash, Dale & Zarkov are brought before evil emperor Ming, who plans a conquest of Earth. While Dr. Zarkov is forced to work in Ming's lab, Flash, Dale and Thun the lion-man flee to the caverns below the city.

title: Chapter Two: The Monsters of Mongo
description: Recaptured by Ming, Dale is taken to the dictator's chambers while Flash and Thun are thrown into the pit mine. Aura's reluctance to lose her Earth man leads her to the mines and the trio escapes to the forest, right into Barin's clutches.

title: Chapter Three: Vultan, King of the Hawkmen
description: Taken by Vultan to the Sky City, Flash, Barin, and Thun escape the atomic furnaces but face new dangers as Ming attacks the city to rescue Aura. Flash saves Vultan from Ming's metal-men, so Vultan vows to join the fight to end Ming's reign.

title: Chapter Four: To Save Earth
description: Ming launches an attack upon Arboria from both the skies and beneath the soil utilizing his mole men. Flash heads below ground, commandeers a drilling machine and bursts into Ming's palace to thwart the impending destruction of Earth.

title: Chapter Five: The Beast Men's Prey
description: Flash, Dale and Zarkov are captured by a group of cavern-dwelling beasts who worship an enormous statue of Ming.

title: Chapter Six: Into the Water World
description: A magnetic ray pulls the heroes' rocket into the underwater city of Coralia, where they're greeted by Queen Undina. Flash's tour of the city is cut short when Ming's Gillmen launch an attack.

title: Chapter Seven: Adventure in Arboria
description: In Arboria, Dr. Zarkov is poisoned by a flying Squirlon as a forest fire rages. Vultan and the Hawkmen deal with the fire, and then Barin and Thun lead Flash and Dale to a perilous underground cavern to find an antidote for Zarkov.

title: Chapter Eight: The Frozen World
description: Flash, Dale, Zarkov and Thun head to Frigia to retrieve the scarce ore Orium to power weapons and machinery. They're welcomed with open arms by Queen Fria, but Count Malo ensures their visit to the frozen land is treacherous.

title: Chapter Nine: Monster of the Glacier
description: Queen Fria and Flash rescue his friends from Brukka and his giant minions but their safe escape is jeopardized by the Glacier Monster, an enormous electric eel.

title: Chapter Ten: Blue Magic
description: Racing on a rocket train from Frigia to Arboria, Flash and his friends detour to Syk, ruled by witch Queen Azura, who believes Flash is the reincarnation of Gor Daahn, her lost love.

title: Chapter Eleven: King Flash
description: Flash has been hypnotized into believing he's the witch King Gor Daahn, so Zarkov has to resort to scientific methods to snap him out of it. With no desire to let him go, Queen Azura unleashes Talors, the Fire King, upon Flash and friends.

title: Chapter Twelve: Tournament of Death
description: Flash and his friends escape from Ming's dungeon to the treacherous caverns below Mingo City, but they're recaptured by Princess Aura and Flash is forced to compete in a tournament against a variety of deadly animals.

title: Chapter Thirteen: Castaways in Tropica
description: Zarkov fixes the rocket, but they run out of fuel and are forced to land in Tropica, where they meet Queen Desira and her cousin Braznor, who's plotting to overthrow her. Meanwhile, Barin & Aura finally profess their love for one another.

title: Chapter Fourteen: The Desert Hawk
description: When Queen Desira, Flash Gordon and friends brave the dangers of the Desert of Fire, they get some help from Gundar the Desert Hawk. Meanwhile, Braznor proclaims the queen dead and seizes control of Tropica.

title: Chapter Fifteen: Revolt of the Power Men
description: Ergon, leader of Ming's power men, goes rogue and aids Flash and his friends in their quest to reclaim Sky City. Meanwhile, Ming makes plans to wed Dale.

title: Chapter Sixteen: Ming's Last Battle
description: Dale agrees to marry Ming if he'll spare Flash's life. Meanwhile, all of the races of Mongo unite to defeat Ming's warriors and collapse his empire.

title: Gremlin the Dragon/Royal Wedding
description: Flash and Dale answer the S.O.S. of Gremlin, a baby dragon who's being terrorized by beast men. Later, a disgruntled Ming sends Aura and Prince Barin a wedding gift - a robot which kidnaps Aura & Dale.

title: Sir Gremlin/Deadly Double
description: Azura the Witch Queen is determined to win Flash's heart, so she sends her Magic Men to capture him - but they return with Dale. Later, Ming's cohort, Dr. Tavv, creates a robotic duplicate of Gremlin to lure Flash to his doom.

title: The Game/The Seed
description: Flash and Dale are captured by Ior, ruler of the Cavern City, who forces Flash to do battle with Athos the giant. Later, Ming and Enak unleash a Trojan Horse upon Arboria in the guise of a meteor which contains a tentacled monster.

title: Witch Woman/Micro Menace
description: Flash and his friends track a giant wolf-like creature called the Lobos to a cavern where they're captured by the Lizard Women. Later, when Sky City's anti-gravity system fails, Flash's attempt to aid is delayed by Ming's shrink-ray.

title: Flash Back/The Warrior
description: Flash finds himself in the negative side of the universe, where he confronts an evil version of himself. Later, Flash, Dale, Gremlin and Ming are brought to The Unexplored Continent to play a deadly game of cat and mouse with The Warrior.

title: The Freedom Balloon/Sacrifice of the Volcano Men
description: Flash and Dale are enslaved by the evil Racar, so they enlist Gremlin to help fashion a hot-air balloon to escape. Later, Thun is captured and taken to Volcano City to be sacrificed to the gods of the volcano.

title: Beware of Gifts/The Memory Bank of Ming
description: As a peace-offering, Ming presents the people of Arboria with a giant statue which comes alive and terrorizes the city. Later, Barin reprograms and relaunches Ming's computer, but Gremlin accidentally reverts it to the previous programming.

title: Survival Game/Gremlin's Finest Hour
description: Ming sends bounty hunter Aarkon Vae to capture Flash, but the men are forced to work together when his ship crash-lands on a remote island. Later, Gremlin is captured by the Lizard People, who mistake him for Gargantus, their god.
